excerpt: Share your .NET expertise with a global audience! JetBrains .NET Days streams live 8–9 Oct 2025. Submit your talk proposal by 15 Aug.

Share it with thousands of developers at JetBrains .NET Days Online 2025 – a free, community-driven event broadcast live around the globe. Submit your talk on Sessionize → TL;DR Live sessions in English, 30 / 45 / 60 min + optional 5–10 min Q&A. We schedule slots that fit your time zone. CFP runs 14 July → 15 August 2025 (one month). All accepted speakers receive a 1-year JetBrains All-Products Pack. First-timers welcome – we’ll review slides and run rehearsals. Need a JetBrains tool for your demo? Ask us for a free trial license. Read our Code of Conduct before submitting. Key dates CFP deadline: 15 August 2025 (23:59 UTC) – get your proposal in! Live event: 8 – 9 October 2025. What type of talks are we looking for? Anything that pushes .NET forward. Popular areas include: Architecture & Design – clean code, DDD, modular monoliths, event-driven patterns. Performance & Diagnostics – profiling, benchmarking, memory tuning. Cloud-native .NET – containers, Aspire, serverless, observability best practices. AI & Machine Learning – OpenAI, Semantic Kernel, ML.NET in production. Language Deep-dives – new C#/F# features, Roslyn tricks, source generators. Web & UI – Blazor, ASP.NET Core, Avalonia, MAUI, WASM. Data & Persistence – EF Core, Dapper, NoSQL patterns, caching strategies. Testing & Quality – property-based testing, mutation testing, resilient pipelines. …or anything else that helps the .NET community learn and ship better software. Need inspiration? Sample session ideas from past events Immutable collections in .NET Decoupling via Async Message Pumps Formatting C# code Taming DI by designing your own container Error-log telemetry: an end-to-end approach Inner-Outer Clean-up: what and how? New speaker? No problem! We love fresh voices. Our advocacy team will: Review your slides and abstract. Run a private rehearsal and give feedback. Help you feel confident on the (virtual) stage. If you’d like to demo Rider, ReSharper, or any other JetBrains product, just ask for a free trial when you submit. html:
Essential productivity kit for .NET and game developers

.NET Tools Events ReSharper Platform Rider

JetBrains .NET Days Online 2025 — Call for Speakers

Streaming worldwide 8 – 9 October 2025

Have you cracked a performance bottleneck?
Built something clever with AI agents?
Discovered a design pattern the .NET world should know?

Share it with thousands of developers at JetBrains .NET Days Online 2025 – a free, community-driven event broadcast live around the globe.

Submit your talk on Sessionize →

TL;DR

  • Live sessions in English, 30 / 45 / 60 min + optional 5–10 min Q&A.
  • We schedule slots that fit your time zone.
  • CFP runs 14 July → 15 August 2025 (one month).
  • All accepted speakers receive a 1-year JetBrains All-Products Pack.
  • First-timers welcome – we’ll review slides and run rehearsals.
  • Need a JetBrains tool for your demo? Ask us for a free trial license.
  • Read our Code of Conduct before submitting.

Key dates

  • CFP deadline: 15 August 2025 (23:59 UTC) – get your proposal in!
  • Live event: 8 – 9 October 2025.

What type of talks are we looking for?

Anything that pushes .NET forward. Popular areas include:

  • Architecture & Design – clean code, DDD, modular monoliths, event-driven patterns.
  • Performance & Diagnostics – profiling, benchmarking, memory tuning.
  • Cloud-native .NET – containers, Aspire, serverless, observability best practices.
  • AI & Machine Learning – OpenAI, Semantic Kernel, ML.NET in production.
  • Language Deep-dives – new C#/F# features, Roslyn tricks, source generators.
  • Web & UI – Blazor, ASP.NET Core, Avalonia, MAUI, WASM.
  • Data & Persistence – EF Core, Dapper, NoSQL patterns, caching strategies.
  • Testing & Quality – property-based testing, mutation testing, resilient pipelines.
  • …or anything else that helps the .NET community learn and ship better software.

Need inspiration? Sample session ideas from past events

  • Immutable collections in .NET
  • Decoupling via Async Message Pumps
  • Formatting C# code
  • Taming DI by designing your own container
  • Error-log telemetry: an end-to-end approach
  • Inner-Outer Clean-up: what and how?

New speaker? No problem!

We love fresh voices. Our advocacy team will:

  • Review your slides and abstract.
  • Run a private rehearsal and give feedback.
  • Help you feel confident on the (virtual) stage.

JetBrains .NET Days Online 2025 — FAQ

> I don’t own a JetBrains license – can I still show the tools?
Yes. If you’d like to demo Rider, ReSharper, or any other JetBrains product, just ask for a free trial when you submit. But remember: using JetBrains tools is optional.

> Do you cover other dev topics?
If it’s useful to .NET developers, pitch it – we read every submission.

> How many submissions can I send?
Up to three per speaker. Focus each abstract on one clear idea.

Ready to share your story?

Outline your idea on Sessionize and hit Submit – it takes only a few minutes.
Know someone who should be on stage? Please share this link!

Propose a talk now
Questions? Email matt.ellis@jetbrains.com.

Subscribe to a monthly digest curated from the .NET Tools blog:

Discover more
